org.apache.ignite.ml.math.decompositions

Class SingularValueDecomposition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ignite.ml.math.decompositions.SingularValueDecomposition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Destroyable

    public class SingularValueDecomposition
extends Object
implements Destroyable
    Compute a singular value decomposition (SVD) of (l x k) matrix m.

    This decomposition can be thought as an extension of EigenDecomposition to rectangular matrices. The factorization we get is following:

    m = u * s * v^{*}, where

    • u is a real or complex unitary matrix.
    • s is a rectangular diagonal matrix with non-negative real numbers on diagonal (these numbers are singular values of m).
    • v is a real or complex unitary matrix.

    If m is real then u and v are also real.

    See also: Wikipedia article on SVD.

    Note: complex case is currently not supported.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double cond()
      Gets the two norm condition number, which is max(S) / min(S) .
      Matrix getS() 
      double[] getSingularValues()
      Gets the diagonal of S, which is a one-dimensional array of singular values.
      Matrix getU()
      Gets the left singular vectors U.
      Matrix getV()
      Gets the right singular vectors V.
      double norm2()
      Gets the two norm, which is max(S).
      int rank()
      Gets effective numerical matrix rank.
